intro: Veronicastrum serpyllifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly serrated edge, while the flowers are arranged in spikes. It blooms from late summer to early autumn, adding a splash of color to its habitat.
